workout_title: Beginner Chest, Shoulder, and Triceps Blast

warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Rotate shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Clasp hands behind your back and gently straighten your arms, feeling a stretch across your chest. Hold for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Raise one arm overhead and bend at the elbow, letting your hand fall behind your head.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Gently push your elbow with your other hand, feeling a stretch in your triceps. Hold for 30 seconds per arm.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet together, arms at your sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Jump, spreading your legs and raising your arms overhead. Return to starting position. Perform for 1 minute.

exercises.setup: Adjust the machine seat so that your back is comfortably supported.  Position yourself so that your shoulders are aligned with the handles. Grip the handles firmly.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit comfortably on the machine with your back straight and feet flat on the floor. Grip the handles firmly, ensuring your elbows are slightly bent.
2. Lower the Handles: Slowly lower the handles towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly flared out.  Inhale as you lower the weight.
3. Press the Handles: Extend your arms to push the handles away from your chest, exhaling as you do so.  Focus on squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid jerking or bouncing the weight.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase weight gradually in subsequent workouts.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, with an overhand grip.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your back flat against the surface. Grip the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width. Lower the bar to your chest.
2. Lower the Bar: Slowly lower the barbell to your chest, keeping your elbows slightly flared out. Inhale as you lower the weight.
3. Press the Bar: Extend your arms to press the barbell upwards, exhaling as you do so. Focus on squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid jerking or bouncing the weight.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Ensure the bar touches your chest for a full range of motion. Increase weight gradually in subsequent workouts.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a stable position throughout the exercise. Focus on squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement.

exercises.setup: Adjust the bench to an incline position (around 30-45 degrees). Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the incline bench with your back flat against the surface. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, ensuring your elbows are slightly bent.
2. Lower the Dumbbells: Slowly lower the dumbbells towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly flared out. Inhale as you lower the weight.
3. Press the Dumbbells: Extend your arms to press the dumbbells upwards, exhaling as you do so. Focus on squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid jerking or bouncing the weight.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase weight gradually in subsequent workouts.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Adjust the cable machine to a comfortable height. Sit on the seat with your back straight and feet flat on the floor. Grip the handles.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit on the seat with your back straight and feet flat on the floor. Grip the handles, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
2. Bring Handles Together: Slowly bring the handles together in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles. Exhale as you bring the handles together.
3. Return to Starting Position: Slowly return the handles to the starting position, feeling a stretch in your chest. Inhale as you return to the starting position.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid jerking or bouncing the weight.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Focus on a controlled movement and a deep stretch in the pecs. Increase weight gradually in subsequent workouts.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and a deep stretch in the pecs.

exercises.setup: Sit on the seat of the cable machine, ensuring your back is straight and your feet are flat on the floor.  Adjust the cable height to a comfortable level. Grip the handles.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit with your back straight and feet flat on the floor.  Hold the handles with a slight bend in your elbows.
2. Extend Arms: Extend your arms outwards, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.  Focus on feeling the stretch in your chest.
3. Bring Handles Together: Slowly bring the handles together in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles. Exhale as you bring the handles together.
4. Return to Starting Position: Slowly return the handles to the starting position, feeling a stretch in your chest. Inhale as you return to the starting position.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid jerking or bouncing the weight.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form. Focus on a controlled movement and a deep stretch in the pecs. Increase weight gradually in subsequent workouts.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your back flat against the surface. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, ensuring your elbows are slightly bent.
2. Extend Arms: Extend your arms outwards, keeping a slight bend in your elbows. Focus on feeling the stretch in your chest.
3. Bring Dumbbells Together: Slowly bring the dumbbells together in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles. Exhale as you bring the dumbbells together.
4. Return to Starting Position: Slowly return the dumbbells to the starting position, feeling a stretch in your chest. Inhale as you return to the starting position.
5. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid jerking or bouncing the weight.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form. Focus on a controlled movement and a deep stretch in the pecs. Increase weight gradually in subsequent workouts.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and a deep stretch in the pecs.

exercises.setup: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a close, narrow grip (slightly narrower than shoulder-width).
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your back flat against the surface. Grip the barbell with a close, narrow grip (slightly narrower than shoulder-width). Lower the bar to your chest.
2. Lower the Bar: Slowly lower the barbell to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body. Inhale as you lower the weight.
3. Press the Bar: Extend your arms to press the barbell upwards, exhaling as you do so. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid jerking or bouncing the weight.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase weight gradually in subsequent workouts.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Attach a straight bar to the cable machine's lower pulley. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grip the straight bar with an overhand grip.
2. Extend Arms: Extend your arms downwards, keeping your elbows close to your body. Exhale as you extend your arms.
3. Return to Starting Position: Slowly return your forearms to the starting position, feeling a stretch in your triceps. Inhale as you return to the starting position.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid jerking or bouncing the weight.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase weight gradually in subsequent workouts.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your elbows close to your body throughout the exercise.

exercises.setup: Position the cable at a low setting and use a bar attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing away from the cable machine with your arms fully extended overhead, holding the bar attachment.  Keep your elbows close to your head.
2. Lower the Bar: Slowly lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows. Inhale as you lower the weight.
3. Extend Arms: Extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on squeezing your triceps. Exhale as you extend your arms.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid jerking or bouncing the weight.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form. Increase weight gradually in subsequent workouts.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width. Extend your arms upwards.
2. Lower the Bar: Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead by bending your elbows. Inhale as you lower the weight.
3. Extend Arms: Extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on squeezing your triceps. Exhale as you extend your arms.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled pace throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid jerking or bouncing the weight.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form. Ensure a full range of motion, focusing on the stretch and contraction of the triceps. Increase weight gradually in subsequent workouts.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your elbows close to your head throughout the exercise.
